raw_comment: The graph shows how likely young adults either female or male interact with their parents each time a week. It says that they either text, call, or actually talk to their parent in person. The graph shows that they are most likely to send a text to their parents with it being roughly 50% males will text their parents while 75% females will text their parents. The least likely to be done is actually visiting the parent in person with only 26% females and roughly 18%. There is definitely a difference here with males always being in the lower margin and females being in the larger margin. This most likely has to do with the gender differences between males and females.
ace_sentences: The graph shows how likely young adults interact with their parents each week.
A young adult is either female or male.
The graph says that young adults text their parents.
The graph says that young adults call their parents.
The graph says that young adults talk to their parents in person.
About 50% of male young adults text their parents each week.
About 75% of female young adults text their parents each week.
About 26% of female young adults visit a parent in person each week.
About 18% of male young adults visit a parent in person each week.
Male young adults have lower percentages than female young adults in these interactions.
Female young adults have higher percentages than male young adults in these interactions.
This difference may relate to gender differences between males and females.
